author: mwbrooks
msg: Remove markdown files for the Position properties, since Position.markdown covers them.

author: mwbrooks
msg: Update Details section of Coordinates.
After writing the Position documentation, I realized that the
details of the Coordinates were incorrect. The Coordinate is not
directly returned to the user, instead it is attached to the Position
and then returned to the user.

author: mwbrooks
msg: Update Coordinates object based on current content and W3C spec.
- The documentation has only been tested on the iPhone.
- Currently, there is iPhone specific code in the examples,
that conflict with the W3C spec. Once another platform is tested
the iPhone specific code can be moved to the iPhone documentation
of the Coordinates object.

author: mwbrooks
msg: Update the Coordinates object using the current content and W3C API.
- Removed the markdown files that documented individual properties.
This approach was original chosen for organization, but it is
confusing when documenting properties.
- Coordinates::accuracy is a controversial property. The iPhone
returns an object { horizontal: Number, vertical: Number }
although W3C appears to document it as a single value.
Since altitude's accuracy is explicitly mentioned, it makes me
think that accuracy should be a single value that reflects
the accuracy of both latitude and longitude.
- Once another platform is tested against this documentation,
we can update the definition of accuracy.

author: mwbrooks
msg: Update the full exmaple of geolocation.watchPosition for clarity.
